page.title: 01Llangunllo and Environs
page.content: This sparsely populated area is rural in character. It lies in the upper reaches of the narrow steep-sided, U-shaped valley of the River Lugg. Llangunnlo, a small long-established nucleated village, clusters around the church on the banks of the river in Square 5. It lies at an average height of 240 metres. The land around the village consists of relatively small family farms devolted to livestock farming. The majority of thesse farms average 200 - 300 acres, their main enterprise being sheep. The village is seven miles from Knighton, the nearest town, thirty - eight miles from Hereford and fourty miles from Shrewsbury. This area of the Welsh borders is served by a road network of country lanes, 'B' and minor 'A' roads.
